result.execSummary:
The defendant Keegin E Neveln was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc; unpaid court obligations of $429
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 15CF98 and 15CF139.  No objection to revoke DPA on 15CF98.  Court ordered Judgment of Conviction to be entered.  In 15CF98 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  No contact with MJR.  12 month review.  Upon release from jail, he must live with his mother until changed by probation agent.  Must be employed or remain in school.  1 day credit.  In 15CF139 Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months jail each count, concurrent to each other, with Huber for school, work or treatment.  A civil judgment for unpaid costs.  167 days credit.  Jail starts forthwith.  1:46/2:03
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-29-2016 01:30 pm
Request for reset of March 8th hearing from Atty. Lawton
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-08-2016 11:30 am
Court memo from Probation Agent Joshua Champion
and Revocation Summary w/attachments filed by Probation Agent Joshua Chamption, Portage office

ADDRESS INFO for Keegin E Neveln

Prior: N9534 Muskrat Road, Portage, WI 53901
Appointed Attorney Mark Lawton

Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Cases called at 11:10. Cases heard: 15CF139 & 15CF98, Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.   ADA Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 15CF98, Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Information filed; reading waived. Amended Complaint filed in 15CF139; reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2,3 in 15CF139. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yrs. probation, $443, $243, $243 costs. Treatment and counseling per agent. High school diploma or equivalent. Case may be expunged upon successful completion of probation. In 15CF98, Defendant pled no contest. Judgment withheld. Court accepted Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Case held open 5 yrs. for compliance. 1 day jail credit in 15CF98 and 10 days sentence credit in 15CF139.
plea on October 9 at 11 am
plea on August 25 at 11:00 a.m.

Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF98 & 15CF139.  Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing in 15CF139.  Atty Lawton requested a pretrial and return date for both cases.  State had no objection. Bond remains.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Keegin E Neveln by video, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $500.00 cash bond.  Standard felony conditions.  No contact with T.H.  Court will consider modification of bond if there is an in-patient program that defendant will be required to stay at with out the ability to walk away.  Defendant did not waive time limits.
